data.title: Our people
data.meta_description:
Here you can find details of all members of BIMCO staff - and the members of our committees and Board of Directors. 
If you are not sure who to contact at BIMCO, you can use our
data.text:
Leadership

The BIMCO Leadership consists of the Secretary General, the three Deputy Secretary Generals who manage the three major parts of the BIMCO organisation, the three Chief Officers for Finance, Technology and Communications as well as one Director.

Secretary General / Chief Executive Officer

David Loosley

dl@bimco.org

Membership

The Membership and Business Development team handles dialogue with members around their membership status and payment. The team develops the business side of BIMCO’s activities, while Membership Engagement is responsible for events, networks and panels for members etc.

Standards Innovation and Research

The Standards, Innovation and Research team drives the shipping industry towards digital transformation and products by developing open digital standards, promoting harmonisation and interoperability, and collaborating on research into future business trends.

Manager, Standards, Innovation and Research

Mads Wacher Kjærgaard

mwk@bimco.org

Maritime Information

The Maritime Information team is responsible for Shipping KPI, cargo databases including IMO work, ice information, Holiday Calendar, port information including taxes and tariffs, working hours, etc.

The Maritime Safety & Security Team delivers input to regulation, develops standards and best practice, and offers guidance to members on matters related to safety, security, and trade facilitation.

Board of Directors

The BIMCO Board of Directors (BoD) consists of shipowner members elected by BIMCO’s members or appointed in their personal capacity by the BoD. The role and responsibility of the BoD is to ensure that BIMCO is governed in accordance with the BIMCO Rules and in adherence to the Vision and Mission Statements of BIMCO. The BoD normally meets twice a year.

Executive Committee

The Executive Committee (EC) consists of Directors of BIMCO and conducts the business and affairs of BIMCO under the control and supervision of the Board of Directors. The EC normally meets three times a year.
